alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 31 at 9:45AM CDT until April 03 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse zones. Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .An area of low pressure will transit east across the region today bringing locally heavy rain and thunderstorms. Rain falling on top of an existing snowpack will lead to additional water entering the rivers. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is likely. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 40.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage is expected to be reached Saturday afternoon based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM CDT.
